All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
CalendarApp
Main class for the Calendar Application.
CalendarComponent
Contains static methods for configuring and updating calendar views within the application.
CalendarViewComponent
Utility class providing static methods to manage views within a calendar UI component.
DailyGoalsComponent
Provides static utility methods to manage and display the daily goals component in the user interface.
Day
Class representing a single day as an object.
EndOfDayComponent
Provides static methods for managing end-of-day notifications and updates within the calendar UI.
Event
Event class represents an event in the calendar
EventDAO
EventDAO class is used to interact with the database for events
EventListener
Class responsible for managing calendar events and interfacing with the EventDAO for database operations.
EventLoader
Class handling loading and creation of calendars.
Goal
Goal class represents a goal in the application
GoalController
Goal controller class handles the interface between GoalDAO and the calendars.
GoalDAO
GoalDAO class is used to interact with the database for goals
GoalTracking
Represents the tracking information of a goal, including its completion status and date.
GoalTrackingDAO
GoalTrackingDAO class manages the database operations for the Goal Tracking table
NavigationBar
The NavigationBar class extends DateControl to provide navigation controls for DetailedDayView and DetailedWeekView.
Optimiser
Class object handling the optimization of user calendars.
OptimizerUtil
Class containing optimizer utility functions that are static.
RightPanelComponent
Contains static methods to manage and manipulate the right panel of the application's UI, which includes action components like switching views, adding goals, and optimizing events.
RoutineOneController
Class representing Routine 1 of the Optimizer pipeline.
RoutineTwoController
Class representing Routine 1 of the Optimizer pipeline.
SqliteConnection
SqliteConnection class creates a connection to the SQLite database Singleton pattern is used to ensure only one connection is created
TimeWindow
Class representing a window of time.
